title: Microsoft introduces Surface Pro X with custom chipset, previews dual-screen Neo device for next year
text: Microsoft Corp. MSFT, -2.19% continued its parade of product announcements on Wednesday with the introduction of the Surface Pro X device, which has a 13-inch display in a 12-inch form factor. The device runs a custom Microsoft SQ1 chipset. The company says that brings together Qualcomm Inc.'s QCOM, -1.91% Snapdragon mobile capabilities with artificial-intelligence tools. It will sell for $999 starting on Nov. 5, though preorders are open today. Earlier this morning, Microsoft debuted the new Surface Pro 7, Surface Laptop 3, and Surface Earbuds. The company called this its biggest lineup to date. Microsoft also previewed a product that will launch next holiday season, the Surface Neo, which can be held like a book and brings two nine-inch screens together. Shares are down 2.3% in Wednesday morning trading as the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, -1.93% is off 1.7%.
